unit_learning_outcomes.description: Enhance the ability in independent and reflective learning through assessing and responding to ideas
Analyze English texts in various contexts
Demonstrate enhanced skills of using dictionaries and other tools in translation
Identify and discuss key translation theories
Conduct cohesive English-Chinese translation within given time

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on translation practice, reflection of their translation practice and going through relevant materials provided in iLearn.

enrolment_rules.description: 20cp at 2000 level including CHIN2052 or CHIN2053

assessments.description: Students are expected to prepare for and participate in discussions actively. The workload of this task is included in learning activities.
Students are expected to present on the translation strategies they adopted for their translation.
Students will do a translation test by the end of the semester.
Students are expected to take notes when translating and reflect on their translation practice. A reflective journal needs to be submitted.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit introduces key translation theories and skills and encourages their use in English-Chinese translation practice. Students who enjoy both Chinese and English language proficiency will enhance their skills of analyzing and comprehending English texts in various contexts as well as delivering equivalent message in idiomatic Chinese. Students will also enhance their skills of delivering coherent texts in Chinese and be able to identify and solve problems when translating.
data.title: English-Chinese Translation II

description: This unit introduces key translation theories and skills and encourages their use in English-Chinese translation practice. Students who enjoy both Chinese and English language proficiency will enhance their skills of analyzing and comprehending English texts in various contexts as well as delivering equivalent message in idiomatic Chinese. Students will also enhance their skills of delivering coherent texts in Chinese and be able to identify and solve problems when translating.
title: English-Chinese Translation II
